intro: Acetosella psoralioides, commonly known as the rock sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. It is known for its ability to tolerate harsh conditions, including cold temperatures and poor soil fertility. Acetosella psoralioides is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
